title: Unable to install via Nuget
body:
Trying to install via NuGet Manager in latest VS 2019 in .net core project but get

Error		Package restore failed. Rolling back package changes for 'SkiaSharp'.		

Error	NU1108	Cycle detected. 
  SkiaSharp -> SkiaSharp (>= 2.80.2).	SkiaSharp	

Other NuGet packages are installing fine.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
That is very weird... There shouldn't be any cycles, and you can even see that there are none on nuget:
https://www.nuget.org/packages/skiasharp

What you can maybe try is deleting all the skiasharp folders in your nuget cache - or just clear everything (as there is probably like 50 GB there by now)

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-locals

```
nuget locals all -clear
```

You might have a bad package for some reason. Unless you have a project in your solution named SkiaSharp? Maybe VS is getting confused?

comments.author: bsweb
comments.body:
Hi Matthew,

I think there is a bug with VS as I just experienced the same with FormFactory as my scratch pad project was called the same as the package and I got the same error. I had called the project I reported to you SkiaSharp.

Have reported bug to MS.

Cheers
Chris

That is very weird... There shouldn't be any cycles, and you can even see that there are none on nuget:
https://www.nuget.org/packages/skiasharp

What you can maybe try is deleting all the skiasharp folders in your nuget cache - or just clear everything (as there is probably like 50 GB there by now)

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-locals

nuget locals all -clear

You might have a bad package for some reason. Unless you have a project in your solution named SkiaSharp? Maybe VS is getting confused?
